subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] get your news in QS!
msgSnippet: I just realized that the PDF format makes it possible to read QuickScript on the iPhone, a first! Is there any way to make the page margins and column width a
messageBody:
I just realized that the PDF format makes it possible to read QuickScript on the iPhone, a first!

Is there any way to make the page margins and column width a bit smaller, so that the default size/zoom is a bit better on my personal toy of choice?  :)

oliver


On 11 Nov 2007, at 12:40, Paige Gabhart wrote:

Paul:

Let me add my superlatives to the others.  News in QS just blew me away.  One of our big problems was providing interesting items for reading practice.  This solves that problem beautifully.  It also makes me realize how much more reading practice I need to get truly fluent in reading QS.

I see some issues regarding the dictionary that remain to be addressed and how the transliteration works -- as you said, it is experimental, but my hat is off to you.  Great work.

Paige

P.S.  The font looks great too.

Paul Tremblay wrote:

Hi group,

I have seemed to work out a way to download the top stores, convert 
these stories to Quikscript, and post them on my site. The whole process 
is just an experiment right now. The method I use is automatic, so I 
should be able to upload the news daily, or even hourly if I wanted.

The news consists of 8 articles, and I apologize that the headlines are 
slanted for Americans. The converter I use relies on a raw dictionary 
that uses "Awl" where others might use "On." Normally when converting to 
QS, I use a custom dictionary and add to it each time, but for the news, 
which I can't read over and check, I needed a method that would convert 
all words rather than convert most words perfectly.

The link is

http://quikscript. sourceforge. net/qs_news. pdf

Paul
